label: 立文
本: A Tale of Flowering Fortunes:  Annals of Japanese Aristocratic Life in the Heian Period (Volumes One and Two) . Stanford University Press . 1980
説明文: The formal communication known as tatebumi consisted of two parts:  a strip of paper bearing a poem or other message, and a narrow outer envelope made of white paper, folded lengthwise, and twisted and bent at both ends (p. 291n).
